title: Retro Cycling Champions
description: Pedal through the decades and remember the legendary cyclists and epic races that thrilled fans around the world!

questions.question: Which Belgian cyclist, nicknamed 'The Cannibal,' is widely considered the greatest cyclist of all time and dominated the sport in the late 1960s-70s?
Eddy Merckx won the Tour de France how many times?
The Tour de France, the world's most famous bicycle race, is held annually in which month?
Which Italian cyclist, known as 'The Campionissimo' (Champion of Champions), won the Giro d'Italia five times?
The legendary rivalry between Fausto Coppi and Gino Bartali divided which country's cycling fans in the 1940s-50s?
The Tour de France leader wears a distinctive jersey of what color?
Which French cyclist won the Tour de France five consecutive times from 1961 to 1964 plus 1957?
Bernard Hinault, nicknamed 'The Badger,' was the last French cyclist to win the Tour de France. In what year was his final victory?
The Schwinn Varsity and Continental were iconic American bicycles popular during the cycling boom of which decade?
Which American cyclist won the 1984 Olympic road race, bringing cycling attention to the U.S.?
Greg LeMond became the first American to win the Tour de France in which year?
The Six-Day Race, a popular cycling event held in indoor velodromes, was a major spectator sport in which American city in the 1940s-50s?
Which classic one-day cycling race, held in Belgium, is known as 'The Hell of the North' for its brutal cobblestone sections?
The Giro d'Italia, one of cycling's three Grand Tours, takes place in which country?
Which Spanish cyclist won the Tour de France five times, matching the records of Anquetil and Merckx, in 1969, 1970, 1971, 1972, and 1973?
